div.l: Here is ended the Millers tale
Here bygynnyth the Reues tale tale ꝓprologe
Whan folke hadde laughen / at thys nyce caas
Of Absolon and hende Nicholas
Dyủers folke dyủersely they seyde
But for the more part · they lough and pleyde
Ne at his tale I saugh noman hym greue
But it were oonly Osewold the Reue
Bycause he was of Carpenters Crafte
A litel Ire is in hys herte y lafte
He gan to grucche and blamed it a lite
So theeLikthee ikthee Lik quod he ful wele koude I yow quyte
With bleryng of a proud Milleris ye
Yf that me lyste speke of rebaudye
But ik am olde / me lust not pleye for age
GGras tyme is doon / my fodder is now forage marginalium by a later hand
This white topp̄e writeth myne olde yeris
Myn herte is also mouled as myn heer is

l.hi: But if I fare as doth an open ers
That ilke fruyt is eủer lenger the wers
Til it be roten in mullok or in stree
We olde men / I drede so faren we

div.l: Tyl we beebee rotyn kan we not be rype
We hoppen alway while that the world wol pipe

l.hi: For in oure wille there stiketh eủer anail
To han an hoore heed and a grene tail

div.l: DAs hath a leek for though that oure myght be goon marginalium in later hand
Oure wille desireth folye eủer in oon
For whan we may nat doon than wil we speke
Yet in oure Asshes olde / is fuyr y reeke
Foure gledes han we / whiche I shall deuyse
Auauntyng / lying / Anger / and couetyse
These foure sparkles longen vn to elde
Oure olde lymes mowe wele ben vnwelde
But wille ne shal nat faile that is soth
And yet haue I alwey a coltes toth
As many a yere as it is passed henne
Sith that my tap of lyfe bygan to renne
